infoPages.title: Main
infoPages.content:
This website is where I post my articles. Articles on literally Anything. Kinda like it's a second brain.
This is my Obsidian vault turned into a website with Quartz v4.1.5.

Easy Navmap to navigate my articles.

infoPages.title: Main
infoPages.content:
This is my old website which is just a dump where I used to test stuff, or just place random things that I thought would be fun.
This website has different homepages dependign on your device, but it is intended for Desktop users.
It had a whole Achievement / easteregg finding gig.

The design analysis behind this website is not: "Is this a good place for this?", No it goes like: "Hmm where should I place this big clicker game, hmm 1 small button between anything else is a good idea."
This way it has lots of secrets to find.

Easteregg collector.

This website is made with Angular, PHP (backend that might be offline now), MySQL, and a lot of love.

It can run Doom.

This was my main website for a long time, but I have moved on to a new website, but I still keep this one up for the memories.
The reason I switched websites is because it is not really easy access to information like "My projects" etc, and I made the new website at the same time I got my VPS, which made it easy to combine front and back-end.

infoPages.title: Main
infoPages.content:
This is a website I made as a summer project.

âœ¨Totally Normal Chess Simulatorâœ¨

This project started as a normal chess game (without En passant / castling), Reddit had the power to decide what would be added in the next update. Normal chess things or not, didn't matter.
This happened 7 times:

  1. Added Microtransactions
  2. Added Lootboxes
  3. Added Merging Pieces
  4. Added carrying pieces
  5. Added a twist selector
  6. Added a tech tree
  7. Added more pawn varients

Anyone can play this game for free. It's a fun project that I'm proud of.

Tech tree.

Technologies used:

  • HTML
  • CSS
  • JavaScript

You can play this on mobile or desktop, it even has settings to suit your preferences.

Project Kazamata is a Game Engine / Framework I am making.

The framework.

This is completely customisable. I was / am going to make my own game with it as a Demo.
It is an RPG framework. It even has it's own CLI. (command line interface)

Github

It is open source and can be found on Github

infoPages.title: Main
infoPages.content:
This is my main website. Odds are that you are currently already on this website.
I use this website to display my projects, Manage my database. etc.
It is the first time that I have used:

  1. Node Backend
  2. Account system
  3. CRUD Editor
  4. React
  5. Bootstrap

This website is heavily inspired by things like Marvels S.H.I.E.L.D.

Accounts have an Clearance Level.

An account on this website is invite only, that's why there is an guest account button.

More Marvel inspired things on the Signup page.

There are some big plans for this website. But we'll see if it happens or not :3

The Register page, if you received an invite link

infoPages.title: Main
infoPages.content:
Project Betacraft Explorer is a unique Minecraft playthrough where I start from Alpha v1.0.1_01 and progress through the game's versions. Here's how it works:

  1. I use Betacraft to play older versions of Minecraft.
  2. Every time I reopen Minecraft, I update the game by one minor version (excluding April Fools versions).
  3. If I die, I restart the game in a newer version.
  4. I log my progress for each version in a diary.
  5. Each version is played for a maximum of 30 minutes (until we reach the official releases).
  6. If I'm watching YouTube while playing, I switch versions when I need to find a new video (or based on the above rules if the video is longer).

To keep track of my progress and ensure I don't lose any data, I've set up an automatic backup system:

An interesting bug discovery during the playthrough.

I created a Python script to automatically commit changes to a Git repository. The script uses Git LFS (Large File Storage) to handle the potentially large world files efficiently. You can find the script in my Python toolkit repository.

Screenshot of a time where my Minecraft crashed.

Throughout this project, I've encountered various interesting situations, from game crashes to unusual glitches. For example, in version 13w02a-1613, my game crashed because my pickaxe broke while I was digging a tunnel.

The exciting moment of finding my first diamonds!

As of the latest entry (1.5), I've made significant progress, including finding my first diamonds and completing a major excavation project. It is fun to play through this nostalgic trip and see how much Minecraft has changed over time. I still have a long way to go, Cause Minecraft is at 1.21.2 at the time of this post.

infoPages.title: Main
infoPages.content:
The Roblox Maze Generator is my first project using LUA and Roblox. It's an automatic maze generation script with a wide array of settings, ensuring that every maze is unique and fully accessible.

  1. Automatic Generation: The script creates mazes without manual input.
  2. Full Accessibility: Every location in the maze is always reachable.
  3. Biomes: The maze features different themed areas or "biomes" with unique generation rules.
  4. Randomization: Each generated maze is completely unique.
  5. Customizable Settings: Various parameters can be adjusted to change the maze characteristics.

The maze features different biomes, each with its own generation rules:

  • Hallways: Strict, narrow passages.
  • Rooms: More open areas with randomly placed walls.
A glimpse inside the "rooms" biome, showcasing the open areas with random wall placement.

The development process was filled with interesting challenges and discoveries:

Very early in development, showing the basic structure.

Initially, the project started with simple hallways, but after a while biomes and other variations have been added.

Testing the implementation of vertical hallways, adding a new dimension to the maze.

One of the key features of the generator is its ability to create multi-level mazes, adding vertical complexity to the traditional 2D maze concept.

A funny lighting bug encountered during development, showcasing the unexpected challenges in game development.

Like any development project, there were interesting bugs along the way. Some, like this lighting issue, created unexpectedly beautiful results!

Future plans for the Roblox Maze Generator include:

  • Adding "monsters" to increase challenge and excitement.
  • Implementing a goal-oriented gameplay, giving players a reason to find the exit.

Currently, the maze has only one exit, but the possibilities for expansion are endless. The Roblox Maze Generator represents not just a technical achievement in procedural generation, but also a journey of learning and problem-solving in game development using LUA and Roblox.
